element.name: Oh Bellix! by Fjon, Unknown Cache (2.5/1)
element.description:
The above co-ordinates lead to the car park.
You need to figure out the the puzzle to get to the cache.
element.long-description:
The co-ordinates: N53° 17.ABC, W006° 10.DEF
Solve the crossword below, and convert the letter in the squares A,B,C,D,E,F to the number it occupies in the alphabet.
For example: a is 1, m is 13 and z is 26.
If this number is two digits, add the digits together (for example u=21=3)
Then substitute these numbers into the co-ords above.
Control: If you have got it right, then A+B+C should equal 6, and D+E+F should equal 18.
The cache:
The cache is a micro placed in an area not many people know about.
This is a residential area, so try to park at the given co-ords.
Also, take care when retrieving and replacing the cache so as not to be seen as there can be quite a few people in this area.
Getting there:
From the N11, turn off (East) onto Stillorgan Park.
The turn off is at a major crossroads, near the Leisureplex and Blakes/ Bondi pub/ nightclub.
Follow Stillorgan Park and take a right into St. Augustine's Park.
Park at the above co-ordinates.
Across 1. Musical instruments (6)
4. Raised stage (8)
9. Great seas (6)
10. Holiday (8)
12. Glass triangle that separates light into colours (5)
13. Stretching out over a distance (9)
15. Reproductive part (3)
16. Acquire knowledge (5)
17. Calculate or estimate (6)
22. Toward the back of a boat (6)
24. Dodge, duck (5)
27. Bounder, scoundrel (3)
28. Unable, incompetent (9)
31. Silly ass (5)
32. It's allowed for a foul (4,4)
33. Repeat performance (6)
34. Install a monarch (8)
35. Niche, inlet (6)
Down
1. Without delay or hesitation (8)
2. North and South, they're continents (8)
3. Salves, emollients (9)
5. Lowest, smallest (5)
6. Public transport on the railway (5)
7. Source, derivation (6)
8. Control, direct, run (6)
11. Grade, step or award (6)
14. Large northern deer (3)
18. Call off or invalidate (6)
19. The following of orders (9)
20. Second lowest male singing voice (8)
21. Unable to relax or be still (8)
23. Light afternoon meal (3)
25. Trivial nonsense (6)
26. Distinctive manner of speaking (6)
29. Fire iron and card game (5)
30. Thin slices of smoked ham (5)

ul.li:
2010-06-12T19:00:00Z : Found it by BlueFoxPL
Another great day for caching... found with some friends. TFTC.

2010-06-12T19:00:00Z : Found it by Wicca Cailín
Liked this one thanks. So strange to find a tower like this in the middle of a housing estate!! Found with Colmyster and Bluefox PL. TFTC.

2010-06-12T19:00:00Z : Found it by colmyster
Really enjoyed this puzzel and cache. Thanks... TNLN

2010-05-05T19:00:00Z : Found it by Fitzet
That is one mad looking 'structure' !
I had difficulty retrieving it cos it was pushed far back. I've left it easier to access.
Used the hint.
SL TFTC

2010-03-10T20:00:00Z : Found it by anacreon
Had the solution for this for months, but haven't been in the area. Found quickly at the final location, which is... unusual to find here, to say the least. TFTC!

2007-09-13T07:00:00Z : Found it by Kersti.com
Drat! I hate crosswords! Still, a bit of a think and using one of the clues given I quickly deduced that all I needed was to answer four of the clues correctly to work out the right coordinates. What an amazing place! Looks like someone was doing repair-work but also looks like they haven't been around for a while. Can't believe it's been so long since the last find!

wpt.name: GCVH2H
wpt.desc: Oh Bellix! by Fjon, Unknown Cache (2.5/1)
